author: Special Correspondent
text:
Gandhimathi (42) of Nadanthai village near Paramathi Velur, a record clerk employed at the office of the Joint Director of Health Services here attempted to commit suicide alleging harassment by superior officer.

According to police source, a doctor attached to the Government Hospital, Rasipuram, retired a few months ago. The service book of the retired doctor was received at the office of JD Health Services here recently for the settlement of after-retirement dues. Pearline Mabel Roopamathi, Joint Director of Health Services, demanded the service book of the retired doctor from Gandhimathi, but she repeatedly said that she did not get it. The officer was said to have warned Gandhimathi that she will be forced to prefer a police complaint if she did not handover the service book by Monday.

Following this, Gandhimathi was said to have consumed poison on Sunday evening. She was admitted to the Government Hospital..
title: Suicide bid
